topics.body:
AC Unity was a nightmare, both technically and from a PR standpoint
Far Cry, like I said, is a good game, but it's sort of just a reskin
Watch_Dogs was just far, far below what was promised in all aspects
AC Rogue flew way under the radar, but I've been told it's a case of "Liked Black Flag?  Here's more of that."
and The Crew was plagued with massive technical issues from the very start.

Child of Light was fantastic, I can't say enough good about it (and even that is just my opinion, plenty of people are indifferent to it), so there's a 1/6 success rate.

I think they need to really step the hell back and remember that they're ONE company, and that ONE company should really not be putting out half a dozen games in a single year.
topics.author: 4fde03f9945b7016fb00022a

topics.body:
"@Evident Disaster":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54c372ae6368726830e50d00#post_54c372ae6368726830e50d00

topics.body:
"@Feral_Socks":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54c373c86368724d63290a00#post_54c373c86368724d63290a00
Thanks, I guess I'll be needing it. 
The funny thing is that the game is sort of like a relationship simulator, though I'm kinda trying to avoid going into that area. 
Lot's of funny ideas I'm trying out though, like what happens when you play a prank by swapping out a packet of Pinkie's hot sauce for a packet of laxatives and then giving that to Twilight. 

I'm mean... XD

topics.body:
"@Feral_Socks":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54c373966368720da1811800#post_54c373966368720da1811800
especially with Assassin's creed.
It is totally unreasonable to make and release a game with the size and scope of an assassin's creed game every year and not expect it to be rushed.
Although from what I can tell their Tom Clancy games are still good (Splinter Cell and ghost recon).
